item.title: The Royal Canadian Mint's latest security enhancements
item.dc:creator: jacobk
item.content:encoded:
Dealers, collectors, and investors have always been concerned about the authenticity of their precious metal investments. For this reason, many world-renowned mints have focused their efforts on the implementation of forefront technologies to enhance the security of their bullion products. The Royal Canadian Mint is one of the few mints to have successfully applied several proven techniques which stand against counterfeiting and ease the bullion verification process. On the 16th of May 2016, RCM made one more step towards reinforcing their famed craftsmanship by introducing the latest security measures for their new 2016 1 Oz. 99.99% Gold Bar. The Royal Canadian Mint is a well-known precious metals refiner and manufacturer, worldwide recognized for its thorough approach to implementing the most innovative security measures. This prestigious mint released the new 2016 1 Oz. 99.99% Gold Bar, which has carried the same weight, size and purity content, since debuting in 1999. What makes it truly special is that the new 1 Oz. Gold Bar includes the latest three RCM security enhancements:
  • The uniform striking line pattern – present on both the obverse and reverse side of the bar – being, at the same time, an exquisite touch of contemporary design and an added security feature;
  • The state-of-the-art micro laser-engraved maple leaf –  already used for the iconic Gold and Silver Maple Leaf coins;
  • The micro-engraved “16” inscription inside the maple leafs – ensuring the authentication of the bar through this new inventive way of displaying its mintage year.
The packaging of these outstanding RCM Gold Bars was also redesigned, mimicking the new lined pattern, on the front side, along with the assay certificate on the back side of the tamper-proof card. The Royal Canadian Mint has already used these bullion security enhancements for its most popular precious metals products. The stunning radial line pattern and the micro-engraved maple leaf privy mark were first introduced for the 2014 releases of the Silver Maple Leaf coin. One year later, the mint started to strike the Gold Maple Leaf coin using the same micro-engraved mark and sunburst radial lines, creating an eye-catching light-diffracting pattern and exclusive luster to these already  famous coins. The latest RCM bullion products to receive the new design and security upgrades are the 1 Kilo Gold Bar and the 100 oz. Silver Bar. Each of these bars is stamped with an individual serial number, the mint’s logo and the hallmarked maple leaf, placed on both sides of the weight stamp. These marks have a raised center and a depressed outline similar to the laser engraved privy mark on Silver and Gold Maple Leaf coin. Also, the serial number on the bars is bordered by vertical lines just like the pattern of the maple leaf. Another one-of-a-kind Royal Canadian Mint security initiative is their Bullion DNA Anti-counterfeiting technology launched in 2014. This cutting-edge technology is based on the unique morphological features of each bullion round, aimed to distinguish fake gold coins, as well as silver editions, from authentic Maple Leaf Coins. To achieve the exclusive textured maple leaf mark, which contains the last two digits of the mintage year which are only visible under magnification, the mint laser-engraves the mark on the dies that are used for striking Gold and Silver Maple Leaf Coins. Then, through use of Digital Non-destructive Activation (DNA) technology, the mint converts, encrypts and registers, in its secure database, a special digital code for every die, which is obtained by capturing a microscopic view of each die’s mark. Therefore, when the Bullion DNA is used in store for identifying any fake maple leaf coin, the security mark of the real coin acts as a fingerprint and matches the complex digital code within the RCM die register, thus confirming its authenticity. This leading edge strategy of the Royal Canadian Mint enhances the protection of its exclusive precious metal bars and coins, thereby ensuring the safety of your future investments.

Along with palladium, platinum is a relative new precious metal discovered by Spanish in South America in 1735 and today, over 80% of the platinum is mined exclusively in Russia and South Africa. The US Mint issued, for the first time since 2011, a new bullion medal available in two, S and W, mintmark versions - the 2016 Silver Proof American Liberty Medal. This stunning silver proof medal got quickly sold out during the first 8 minutes from the moment it was placed for sale on the mint’s website on August 23rd, 2016. Hurry up! Get your 2016 S&W Silver Proof American Liberty Medals before they become out of stock! The exceptional 2016 S&W Silver Proof American Liberty Medals showcase a fresh, contemporary design of Liberty, incorporating the ideals of hope and courage. At the same time, the US Mint used its latest manufacturing and digital technology to produce this remarkable bullion product. This fantastic silver proof medal is the symbol of the American proud numismatic heritage and the Nation’s glimmering future because it replicated the praised obverse and reverse design of the $100 American Liberty High Relief Gold Coin, released in 2015. The heads design of the medal was created by Justin Kunz - the talented US Mint Artistic Infusion Program (AIP) designer. It showcases a new representation of Liberty as a modern woman wearing a crown of olive leaves while trustfully holding in her hands the American flag and a lighted torch. This powerful image was sculpted by the remarkable Phebe Hemphill, who delicately engraved her and designer’s initials on the obverse side, along with the inscriptions “Liberty” and “2016”. On the reverse side of the medal is depicted the majestic representation of the beloved American Eagle, created by another talented AIP designer - Paul C. Balan. The image was sculpted by Don Everhart II, the US Mint Sculptor-Engraver, and features a gorgeous eagle gripping an olive branch in its talons while rising in flight – the “embodiment of freedom”. Its image is surrounded by the “DE” and “PCB” initials, the “S” or “W” mintmark and the engraving “United States of America”.   The US Mint struck this beautiful silver proof medals at the West Point and San Francisco facilities by using the American Silver Eagle blanks made of 1 oz. of .999 fine silver. Unlike the Liberty gold coin issued in 2015, the 40.6 mm silver proof Liberty medal is not legal tender, and it doesn’t carry a denomination. The US Mint set a production limit of only 12,500 medals and a household limit of just 2 medals per household. Shipped encapsulated and carefully placed in a delicate blue velvet display mint box, along with a Certificate of Authenticity, the Silver Proof American Liberty Medal is considered a treasured addition for passionate investors and collectors all over the world. item.title: The US Mint releases the 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin on 8th of September
item.dc:creator: jacobk
item.content:encoded:
The second highly anticipated coin of the current year - the 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin - will be soon released by the US Mint. This stunning coin, celebrating 100 years of mintage, will be placed for sale on September 8, 2016, at 12 noon Eastern Time. This breathtaking rendition of an iconic 1916 design is expected to sell out in less than an hour, just like the previous coin in the anniversary series - the 2016 Mercury Dime Centennial Gold Coin. Order your 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin! The US mint centenary anniversary series includes renditions of the three most beloved numismatic coins of 1916:
  • The 2016 Mercury Dime Centennial Gold Coin, released in April 2016
  • The 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin, offered on September 8, 2016
  • The 2016 Walking Liberty Half Dollar Centennial Gold Coin – TBD.
These long-awaited gold coins are highly sought-after by collectors all over the world due to the tremendous popularity of the original circulating coins.   The 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin features the original Bare Breasted “Standing Liberty” depiction, designed by the talented sculptor Hermon A. MacNeil and used for the circulating coin in 1916. However, the image was changed for the 1917-1930 coin issues, having Liberty covered with a chainmail either as a World War I symbol or because of multiple complaints regarding her nudity. On the obverse side of this splendid gold coin is engraved the image of Liberty holding a shield in her left hand and an olive branch in her right hand while stepping through a wall opening which contains the 13 five-pointed stars – the symbol of the Original Thirteen Colonies. This outstanding representation also contains the engravings “Liberty”, “In God We Trust”, “2016”, “AU 24K”, “1/4 oz”, “W” mintmark and the designer’s initial “M”. The reverse side of this beautiful centennial coin showcases a majestic eagle with its wings outstretched, flanked by the 13 stars, seven on the left and six on the right, and encircled by the inscriptions “Quarter Dollar”, “E Pluribus Unum” and “United States of America”. This spectacular coin was struck at the West Point facility from 1/4 troy ounces of .9999 pure gold, the size being the symbol of the coin’s face value. It was produced with reeded edges and business strike finish, with a limited mintage of 100,000 bullion coins and a limited household order of just one coin. The US Mint will provide each coin encapsulated and delicately hand-packaged in an elegant custom-designed black matte hardwood presentation box, accompanied by a Certificate of Authenticity. As the first centennial coin, the Mercury Dime Gold Coin which went off-sale in less than an hour, the new 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin is expected to become a treasured keepsake for numismatists and a must-have for any collector.  The 2016 Standing Liberty Quarter Centennial Gold Coin – Don’t miss the 2nd release in the 100th-anniversary series! item.title: Perth Mint will make available its new coin releases starting with September 6, 2016
item.dc:creator: jacobk
item.content:encoded: Perth Mint will make available its new coin releases starting with September 6, 2016 Perth Mint, Australia’s most beloved bullion producer, plans to release at the beginning of this autumn several new coins from its most exceptional series: the brand-new Silver Kangaroo Four-Coin Set, the Star Trek Silver Delta Shaped Coin, the Lunar Rooster Gold & Silver Proof Coins, and the White Lion Cub Silver Proof Coin. ** September will be a huge month with spectacular releases for the Perth Mint, as the prestigious company plans to impress its collectors and numismatists with these fabulous coins:   The brand-new Silver Kangaroo 4 Silver Proof Coin set The newest 2016 Australian Kangaroo Silver Proof Coin set that will contain 4 coins struck from .9999 pure silver in proof quality is the first set from Perth Mint containing four different sizes: 1/10  oz., ¼ oz., ½ oz. and a 1 oz. This set will be produced with an issue limit of 3,000 bundles. All 4 coins depict the latest 2016 Australian Kangaroo design on their reverse side: the bounding kangaroo which is surrounded by stylized sunlight rays. The image of the unofficial symbol of Australia is encircled by the inscription “Australian Kangaroo”, the ‘P’ mintmark, “2016” and the weight and purity of the coin. The Perth Mint offers this gorgeous set in a classic presentation case with a customized shipper and a numbered Certificate of Authenticity. The 4-coin set is simultaneously released with the ¼ oz. Silver Kangaroo Proof coin, which is provided in an individual packaging with a limited issue of 10,000 coins.   Star Trek Delta shaped silver coin – celebrating 50 years of Star Trek This one-of-a-kind release from Perth Mint is an exceptional gift option for Star Trek fans. This 1 oz. .999 pure silver coin will have the shape of the Delta Shield from the famous Star Trek science fiction series produced by Gene Roddenberry, which debuted in 1966 and ran until 1969. The Delta Shield shaped coin will feature the 50th Anniversary Delta Shield logo on its reverse side. The coin will be issued as a Tuvalu legal tender coin, offered in a contemporary acrylic display case, and will be accompanied by a numbered Certificate of Authenticity. The Perth Mint will produce no more than 5,000 of these outstanding coins celebrating the Star Trek 50th anniversary – a true must-have for any Star Trek fan or collector!   The 2017 Lunar Rooster Gold & Silver Proof & Bullion coins The internationally renowned Australian Gold and Silver Lunar Series II will be completed with the 2017 proof and bullion issues that celebrate the Year of the Rooster – the 10th animal in the Chinese Zodiac Calendar. The birth dates for the ‘Year of the Rooster’ are 1921, 1933, 1945, 1957, 1969, 1981, 1993, 2005, and 2017. The people born under this sign are considered as hardworking, honest, loyal, and sociable. These famous Lunar Series coins will be struck from .9999 pure gold and .9999 pure silver in proof and bullion quality. The Lunar Rooster Proof Gold Coins will be available in three sizes, 1 oz., ¼ oz. and 1/10 oz., as well as in a three-coin set. These remarkable coins will have a limited issue: no more than 3,000 1oz. coins, 5,000 ¼ coins, 4,000 1/10 oz. coins and 1,500 three-coin sets. The bullion edition will have an unlimited issue of 1/20 oz., 1/10 oz., ¼ oz., ½ oz., 2 oz., 10 oz. and 1 kg gold coins and a maximum of 30,000 1 oz. coins which are expected to be highly collectable. Both proof and bullions coins will depict on their reverse side the new ‘Year of the Rooster’ design: a rooster standing in front of a stylized Chinese scene with bamboo and leaves, encircled by the inscription ‘Year of the Rooster’, the Chinese character for ‘rooster’ and the ‘P’ mintmark. The Lunar Rooster Proof Silver Coins are also available in three sizes, 1 kilo, 1 oz. and ½ oz. and the three-coin set. These fantastic coins will have a limited issue of 500 1 kilo coins, 5,000 1 oz. coins, 8,000 ½ oz. coins, and 1,000 three-coin sets. The bullion versions will have an unlimited issue of 1 kg, 10 oz., 5 oz., 2 oz., and ½ oz. coins and a maximum of 100 10 kg. and 300,000 1 oz. silver coins. Just like the gold edition, the 1 oz. silver bullion “The Year of Rooster” coin is expected to sell out quickly. Both proof and bullion silver coins feature on their reverse side the new ‘Year of the Rooster’ design: the rooster, hen and the three chicks standing amongst flowers and bamboo, surrounded by the ‘P’ mintmark, the engraving ‘Year of the Rooster’ and the Chinese character for ‘rooster’.   4th issue in the adorable Cubs series – This year’s latest Perth Mint release - the Cub series - will be completed with the fourth coin - the September Cubs - which features the playful white lion cubs from South Africa, Timbavati region. This impressive coin will be struck as a Tuvalu legal tender coin, made from ½ oz. of .999 fine silver with a limited mintage of 5,000 coins, depicting the cute white lion design. The white lion’s color of the coat is white, almost blonde color, which is much lighter than the usual tawny African lion. These lion species are in fact the same, but their white coat is the result of a recessive gene that is carried by both parents which can give birth to both tawny and white cubs. The previous coins depicted the tiger, jaguar and snow leopard cubs and the lynx cub will be depicted on the last, fifth coin in the series. On the reverse side of this amazing coin are depicted two colored white lion cubs that are playing in the savannah’s grass, surrounded by the word “CUBS” and the ‘P’ mintmark. Besides the classic Perth Mint presentation case, the mint also provides a special display box which can be completed with all five coins that will protect and present them in a superb way. ** On the obverse side of each of these coins is engraved the effigy of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, designed by Ian Rank-Broadley, along with the coin’s face value, weight and purity marks. item.title: 2017 brings the 1st Silver, Platinum, and new Gold Krugerrand Sizes
item.dc:creator: jacobk
item.content:encoded: In 2017, the South African Government celebrates the 50th anniversary of the first ever gold bullion coin in the world – the Gold Krugerrand. To commemorate 50 years of excellence in producing this stunning gold coin, the South African Mint will release several exceptional world premieres: the first 1 oz. Silver Krugerrand (released on December 5th, 2016), the first 1 oz. Proof Platinum Krugerrand and the first 50 oz., 5 oz., 1/20 oz., and 1/50 oz. Proof Gold Krugerrand. ** In 1967, the 1 oz. Gold Krugerrand was released to promote the South African gold and help it establish as an international investment vehicle. Today, the name Gold Krugerrand is the renowned worldwide symbol for investing in gold. However, the year 2017 will give you several new reasons to associate this prestigious name with the most exclusive and astounding coin releases on the bullion market:   The first 1 oz. Silver Krugerrand Enthusiast numismatists of the series have been waiting for a long time for the Krugerrand silver edition to debut. Over this period, many counterfeit silver Krugerrands have been confusing collectors that this coin exists. Finally, in 2017, The Silver Krugerrand became a reality, being also the first Krugerrand that carries an actual face value of 1 Rand. The coin showcases the same obverse and reverse designs of the original gold coin, created by Otto Schultz and Coert Steynberg, except for the content inscription and the small privy stamp with the encircled “50” engraving. The South African Mint will issue the first 1 oz. Silver Krugerrand from .999 pure silver, available in two versions: Premium Uncirculated, available from December 5th, 2016, (having a higher quality than the common Bullion Uncirculated), with a limited mintage of 500,000 coins, and Proof, with an issue limit of 15,000 coins. Also, a few of these coins will be included in some mint’s anniversary sets. The first 1 oz. Silver Krugerrand will be a fantastic addition, highly awaited by investors and collectors around the world for 50 years.   The first 1 oz. Proof Platinum Krugerrand The brand-new Silver Krugerrand is not the only anniversary achievement from the South African Mint. In 2017, the mint will also issue the very first 1 oz. Proof Platinum Krugerrand Coin. The 1,967 proof .9999 fine platinum coins with a 10 Rand face value will represent the mint’s unique commitment to celebrating the year when this famous coin was released for the first time - 1967. The coins will feature the same design as the original Krugerrands, except for the content engraving, and are expected to be highly collectible.   The first 50 oz., 5 oz., 1/20 oz., and 1/50 oz. Proof Gold Krugerrands The South African Ministry of Finance authorized the production of the 50 oz., 5 oz., 1/20 oz., and 1/50 oz. Gold Krugerrands – the biggest and smallest Krugerrands in history. These wonderful coins will be struck from .9167 pure gold, yet will contain their exact engraved amount of pure gold, just like all Gold Krugerrands. The coins will display the same design and will have a limited issue of 50,000 coins for 1/50 oz., 20,000 coins for 1/20 oz., 500 coins for 5 oz., and just 50 coins for the 50 oz. size. The last coin size is a huge sensation, having a 4” diameter and over 1.6 kg in weight, being the special 50th-anniversary edition of the Gold Krugerrand. The mint will also issue the standard 1 oz. coin with a special 50th anniversary privy mark.   The South African Mint The official mint of the Republic of South Africa has over 100 years of experience in producing high-quality circulation and commemorative coins. The South African Mint was founded in 1886 by Paul Kruger in Pretoria and was run by the British Royal Mint up until 1941. Starting from 1961, the mint produces the country’s official currency and the most renowned gold bullion coin highly praised by investors all over the world – the Gold Krugerrand.   The History of Gold Krugerrands The Gold Krugerrands were the first gold bullion coins designed to be a convenient way of owning some of the South African gold. The first Gold Krugerrand coin was struck by the South African Mint on the 3rd of July 1967 from 22K gold, yet contained exactly 1 oz. pure gold – a trademark of the mint’s excellence. Today, the term “Krugerrand” is known by millions of investors around the world. The coin’s name was inspired by the renowned South African President, Paul Kruger, and the country’s monetary currency – Rand. The obverse design of the coin was based on the ZAR (Zuid Afrikaansche Republiek) coin, also known as the Kruger Pond, which depicted the profile portrait of President Kruger. On the reverse side of the coin is engraved the stunning image of a prancing Springbok, the iconic African antelope. In 1980, the mint added three new fractional sizes: 1/10 oz., ¼ oz. and ½ oz. Each of these coins contains the exact amount of gold. Therefore, their weight is a little higher due to the additional content of copper. As the first gold bullion coin in the world, the Gold Krugerrand was an instant success on the bullion market and continues to be one of the most popular collectibles in the world.

item.title: 2016 - 2020 Silver & Gold Queen's Beasts Release Updates
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
Most of the internationally known and praised coins in the bullion market have decades of history in their mintage, but this Queen’s Beasts series is a new and exclusive release from the Royal Mint. The Queen’s Beasts series, inspired by hundreds of years of royal heraldry, includes ten coin designs, based on animals and mythical creatures. For over 500 years British monarchs have used beasts to symbolize their royal ancestry and family allegiances. The original Queen’s Beasts were a set of ten heraldic statues produced by the Ministry of Works for the coronation ceremony of Queen Elizabeth II on 2 June 1953. The Beasts stood at six feet in height and were composed of plaster and sculpted by renowned sculptor James Woodford. Here are the released and upcoming design concepts which will form the entire series:
  • 1st– The Lion of England – February 2016
  • 2nd-The Griffin of Edward III – October 2016
  • 3rd– The Red Dragon of Wales – March 2017
  • 4th– The Unicorn of Scotland – September 2017
  • 5th -The Black Bull of Clarence – March 2018
  • 6th- The Falcon of the Plantagenets – September 2018
  • 7th- The Yale of Beaufort – March 2019
  • 8th– The White Lion of Mortimer – September 2019
  • 9th– The White Horse of Hanover – March 2020
  • 10th-The White Greyhound of Richmond – September 2020
Meanwhile, the Royal Mint hasn’t announced the final coins’ designs for 2018-2020 yet and no photos of coins are on hand now. History tells us that at the coronation of Her Majesty The Queen, ten heraldic beasts stood guard. These creatures symbolized the various strands of royal ancestry brought together in the young woman about to be crowned queen. Each proud beast, used as a heraldic badge by the generations that went before her, was inspired by the King’s Beasts of Henry VIII that still line the bridge over the moat at his Hampton Court Palace. The original plaster statues now sit in the Canadian Museum of History in Gatineau after the Canadian Government took possession of them in July 1959. James Woodford also sculpted a series of replicas out of Portland Stone, which stands proudly in the Kew Gardens of London. History of the previous launches: The first released coin in this series was the Lion of England, probably one of the most familiar beasts in the series. While many of the other beasts are fantastical or mythical creatures, the Lion is a real animal that is easy for people to imagine. The Lion has represented England for centuries and since the twelfth-century Lions have appeared on the coat of arms of every British monarch. It also appears in the Royal Arms, alongside the Scottish Unicorn, supporting the quartered shield, and is featured on many other important items, from coins to British passports. The second release was Griffin of Edward III, an ancient mythical beast. It was considered a beneficent creature, signifying courage and strength combined with guardianship, vigilance, swiftness and keen vision. It was closely associated with Edward III, who engraved it on his private seal. The shield shows the Round Tower of Windsor Castle, where Edward III was born, with the Royal Standard flying from the turret, enclosed by two branches of oak surmounted by the royal crown. Both coins were designed by Royal Mint coin engraver – Jody Clark, who is also a designer of 2017 Britannia coin and Her Majesty the Queen’s 5th portrait. The coins are also issued in silver and gold versions. The obverse of the entire series depicts the portrait of beloved British Monarch – Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. The third release in this series was a Red Dragon of Cadwallader  - the emblem on the Wales national flag. The Red Dragon in this remarkable series displays the beast as clutching in its claws a shield with a lion in each quarter. The coin's obverse as usually depicts the portrait of beloved British Monarch – Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. The fourth release in the Queen's Beasts series is the Unicorn of Scotland.  The Unicorn of Scotland has been brought to life in a contemporary design by prestigious Royal Mint coin designer Jody Clark, who created the current coinage portrait of Her Majesty.  This magic animal is shown standing on its rear legs with its front hooves dangling over the royal badge of England, which includes an image of the Lion of England. The coin is available in silver and gold versions. As well as being an absolutely beautiful piece of artwork and manufactured due to the highest standards, the coin’s content and weight are backed by the UK Government. Limited edition of this series, excellent quality, and legal tender status in the UK make this series a great addition to any precious metals collection. item.title: Introducing the 1st Palladium American Eagle. Low mintage -15,000 coins.
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
The release of the first 2017 1 oz Palladium American Eagle $25 Coin BU is a significant moment in American coinage, which will take the most recognized and demanded American Eagle series into the new field of the precious metals industry. After seven years of studies and development, the US Mint announced that it will launch its first ever Palladium American Eagle in September 2017. One of the rarest precious metals on the market-palladium will join the silver, gold and platinum versions of the famous American Eagles line. This new program will be the first major change to the Eagle program since the release of Platinum American Eagle in 1997.

The history of the first US Mint Palladium Eagle

The US Congress authorized the production of the first Palladium Eagle under the American Eagle Palladium Bullion Coin Act of 2010. The newest American Eagle is an extension of the American Eagle bullion series.  According to this Act, the coin will be stuck in several versions: Uncirculated, Bullion and Proof. After the Congress passed the Act, the Treasury Secretary commissioned an independent third-party study ascertaining the market demand for the new palladium coin. The findings of this study were submitted to the Secretary in 2013 and were supposed to conclude over the economic feasibility of the coins’ mintage, hence determining their availability. Public Law also includes an option for the U.S. Mint to strike American Palladium Eagles in collector proof and uncirculated qualities. If a proof is made, the law requires that they come from the West Point Mint.

What makes the 2017 Palladium American Eagle so special?

  1. It’s the 1st official US Mint palladium coin - Only a few mints around the globe use rare palladium in their bullion production, making the Palladium American Eagle a highly exclusive coin.
  2. Only 15,000 coins minted! This is a very low mintage, and the coins are likely to be sold fast.
  3. It carries one of the Nation’s most beloved designs - the “Winged Liberty” considered to be a major factor that will increase the popularity of the coin. This is one of the most beautiful designs ever minted in American coinage.
  4. A Proof version of the coin will be struck in 2018 at the West Point Mint and bear "W" Mint mark. It will have the same design as the 2017 bullion version.

The famous “Winged Liberty” design.

The obverse side of the coin features the rendition of one of the most attractive designs ever featured in US mintage. Originally created by Adolph A. Weinman for the ‘Mercury Dime”, the “Winged Liberty” is considered as one of the most graceful artworks among collectors around the globe. Struck from 1916 to 1945, the coin was called “Mercury Dime” due to its similarity to the Roman God Mercury. The artwork showcases the profile of Liberty wearing a Phrygian cap – a symbol of power and freedom.  Inscriptions include “LIBERTY,” “IN GOD WE TRUST,” and “2017". The coin’s reverse showcases another creation of A. Weinman, first designed in 1907 for the American Institute of Architects (AIA) Gold Medal. The artwork presents an eagle sitting on the rock and pulling a large tree branch. It is one of the most impressive and admired reverse designs in many years of American coinage history.   The proof and uncirculated versions will also display a mintmark.

2017 Palladium Eagle Program Development. 

The US Mint has worked on securing a reliable list of vendors which shall provide sufficient palladium blanks that meet the Mint's specifications. The blanks must have sufficient dimensions to ensure the successful high relief rendition of the reverse and obverse designs. The diameter of the 2017 Palladium Eagle shall be between 32.7 mm (the diameter of the gold version) and 38.1 mm (the diameter of the commemorative silver coin). Each US Palladium Eagle coin will be issued with a face value of $25, being legal tender in the United States, and will contain 1 oz. of .9995 fine palladium. Before any of the coins may be produced, the Secretary of the Treasury must commission an independent third-party marketing study into the possible demand for the strikes. The U.S. Mint began researching potential palladium suppliers in 2016. However, the authorizing legislation requires the bullion version of a palladium American Eagle to be produced at any facility other than the West Point Mint. The research and development of the palladium American Eagle were carried in the Philadelphia Mint, where the developmental strikes for a palladium American Eagle bullion coin will be struck using dies based on artwork, which was approved by the Secretary of the Treasury.

When will Palladium American Eagle be available?

First Palladium American Eagle will be launched in September 2017. Like other U.S. Mint bullion, the American Palladium Eagle will be sold in a limited time range on US Mint network and then distribute to authorized retail dealers like Bullion Exchanges. The United States Mint has never issued a coin struck in pure palladium; this bullion is expected to be one of the most anticipated US Mint releases ever. 2018-W 1 oz Proof Palladium American Eagle $25 Coin will be available at the beginning of 2018. Don’t miss a chance to buy 2017 1 oz Palladium American Eagle $25 Coin BU on our website.

Between them is a bundle of wrapped furs marked with “HB” as for Hudson’s Bay Company. In the background, stylized vertical rays represent the northern lights up the sky. This splendid image is a powerful nod to the industry which founded Canada, the fur trade industry, and was designed for the Canadian Voyageur Silver Dollar coins struck between 1935 and 1986. An astonishing symbol of Canadian character and spirit, these impressive coins were the first circulating silver dollars in Canada and were introduced to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of King George V. The obverse sides of the Canada 150 anniversary releases carry the famous effigy of Her Majesty, created by Susanna Blunt, and the unique RCM bullion security features: the radial line background pattern and micro-engraved “17” maple leaf privy mark. item.title: A Galaxy Far, Far Away- New Star Wars Stormtrooper Coin
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
The latest of the unmatched Star Wars Bullion series has just been announced. Released by the New Zealand Mint, these coins feature officially licensed images of popular characters from the Star Wars movie series. Star Wars is one of the top movie franchises of all time, setting its iconic storyline in “a galaxy far, far away.” The New Zealand Mint began this series of coins in 2011, beginning a line of incredible gold and silver coins, and has announced that its latest release will commemorate the Stormtrooper character.

A Galaxy Far, Far Away

Created by George Lucas, this incredibly popular franchise kicked off with its first movie release in 1977. As of 2015, the approximate value of this series was at $42 billion, setting it as the second highest-grossing media franchise of all time. Indeed, it has played an iconic role in popular culture, having launched a boom of science fiction releases in the 1970s and 80s, and has been preserved in the US National Film Registry for its cultural significance. Phrases from this film are often used in colloquial language, specifically “may the Force be with you” which triggered an unofficial holiday, May 4th, as “Star Wars Day”. Stormtroopers are the police force for the Galactic Empire, the backbone of the Imperial Military and the forces that are sent out to stop the Rebel Alliance. Easily identified by their white armor worn over black body gloves, they carry blasters and laser rifles in the films. The Stormtrooper characters underwent a lot of development throughout the film series. In the films that were first released, they had non-identifying personalities, remaining staunchly loyal to the Empire and unremorsefully evil. As the series progressed, the audience learned that during the Clone Wars, they were simply military members who had not yet been absorbed by the Empire and had no real human component to their character, they were simply machines in a human form. In one of the Clone War films, they actually fought for the Jedi, but in a way that didn’t really place them on the good side, instead, they simply acted as a weapon that had been placed in the hands of the Jedi forces. In the more recent releases, we have been able to see a different side altogether of these mostly faceless characters underneath their bucket-shaped helmets, introducing us to Stormtrooper Finn, who actually defects from the Dark Side and leaves the Stormtrooper order behind to join the Rebel forces.

Available in Gold or Silver

These coins are available in gold and silver options. Both weighing in at one troy ounce and with a limited mintage of only 250,000 for silver and 25,000 for gold, these coins will be available for purchase in the beginning of November this year. With a $2 denomination for silver and $250 denomination for gold, these coins can be bought individually or in multiples. The reverse side of these coins showcases an officially licensed, close-up image of a Stormtrooper, armed with his blaster. The satin matt background carries the Imperial symbol and is engraved with the weight and quality of the coin, along with the official logo of the New Zealand Mint and the Lucasfilm copyright stamp. The obverse carries the portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, designed by Ian Rank-Broadley, encircled by the inscriptions “Elizabeth II”, “Two Dollars”, “Niue”, and the year of mintage, 2018. item.title: New Piece of Platinum Proof Series Announced by US Mint
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: Inspired by the Declaration of Independence, a three-year program entitled “Preamble to the Declaration of Independence Platinum Proof Coin Series” was announced yesterday. This series will begin in 2018 and will feature one-ounce proof coins of 99.95% platinum with new, updated designs. Proof coins go through a specialized minting process, where first burnished coin blanks are fitted into presses with special dies. The coin goes through multiple strikes which achieves a floating image effect over a mirrored field. Inspectors then scrutinize the quality of each coin before placing them in a protective plastic capsule and mounting them in a satin-lined velvet case. These coins will come along with an official Certificate of Authenticity and sell at a fixed price. The $100 face value of the American Eagle Platinum Proof Coin sets it apart as the highest denomination of any US legal tender coin. The US Mint has also made available uncirculated versions of the gold and silver American Eagles for collectors, which feature the same designs as the proof versions. Uncirculated coins can be distinguished by their mint marks which show where they were minted. They undergo minting in burnished coin blanks, which are fed one by one by hand into specifically adapted presses. These coins are also carefully inspected before they are put into a protective plastic and then within a box. A Certificate of Authenticity accompanies each of these coins. The American Eagle One Ounce Platinum Proof Coin was first released in 1997 and has always featured the same obverse, a Liberty portrait. The reverse has cycled through different themes, including “Vistas of Liberty”, “Foundations of Democracy”, “The Preamble to the Constitution”, and “Torches of Liberty”. The third decade of this program will see updated obverse designs concurrently designed by the same person, Justin Kunz, along with a new shared reverse design. This series has been designed to reflect the foundation of American principles of life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness, as listed in the Preamble to the Declaration of Independence. The 2018 release carries the Life theme and showcases Lady Liberty planting seeds in a field alongside a child. She carries a sword to symbolize the defense of life. The field around her symbolizes the labor and thought necessary to sustain life. The tree and stream in the background portray nature and the importance of being a good steward of the environment around us. The obverse of this coin is inscribed with “LIFE”, “IN GOD WE TRUST”, “E PLURIBUS UNUM”, “LIBERTY”, and the year of mintage.   The 2019 release celebrates Liberty and features Lady Liberty standing tall over prairies, lakes, and mountains. The rough terrain in the background calls on the American spirit of exploration and the freedom to search for new places, ideas, and ways of life. Lady Liberty’s lips are parted, symbolizing freedom of speech, and the torch she carries acts as a guiding light. She also holds a book to show the need for law and equality. The obverse will be inscribed with “LIBERTY”, “IN GOD WE TRUST”, “E PLURIBUS UNUM”, and “2019”. The 2020 release commemorates the third and final American principle, the Pursuit of Happiness. This coin shows Lady Liberty at work harvesting a rich bounty with a girl at her side. Her bounty symbolizes that which liberty makes possible. The buildings standing behind her symbolize the American path, and the final step of the story shown throughout the series- from the furrowed field to mountains to home and farm. The representative of the hard work and ingenuity needed for success, this third coin wraps up the series. The obverse will carry the inscriptions “HAPPINESS”, “IN GOD WE TRUST”, “E PLURIBUS UNUM”, “LIBERTY”, and the year of mintage. All will share a reverse design of an eagle soaring with an olive branch gripped in its talons, crafted by AIP Designer Patricia Lucas-Morris. They will all be composed of 99.95% platinum and will carry the “W” mintmark. You can follow us on social media or subscribe to our newsletter for getting all additional information on this program.
